block.p: A real estate executive was nominated yesterday by Gov. Eliot Spitzer to become the next chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, the governor's office announced. The nominee, H. Dale Hemmerdinger, is a former chairman of the Citizens Budget Commission and president of the Hemmerdinger Corporation, a real estate development company, the governor's office said. Mr. Hemmerdinger is also president of Atco Properties and Management, a member of the board of Valley National Bank and a trustee of New York University. If confirmed by the State Senate, he will succeed Peter S. Kalikow, a Pataki administration appointee who said recently that it was time for him to move on.
